COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
D.C. Resolution 20-356, effective December 3, 2013

20 DCSTAT 2806

A RESOLUTION
To declare the existence of an emergency with respect to the need to amend Chapter 18 of Title 47 of the
District of Columbia Official Code to exclude from District gross income the value of teaching
awards given to teachers in District public schools and public charter schools.

RESOLVED, BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this
resolution may be cited as the “Tax Exemption for Teacher Awards Emergency Declaration
Resolution of 2013”.

Sec. 2. (a) In 2013, The Milken Foundation awarded 2 District teachers, one of whom is
a District resident, each a $25,000 teaching award.
(b) Other teaching awards may be given this year and certainly in the future. These
exceptional residents should receive the full benefit of their rewards, starting immediately.
(c) There exists an immediate need to exempt the value of these awards from gross
taxable income for 2013, and thereafter.
Sec. 3. The Council of the District of Columbia determines that the circumstances
enumerated in section 2 constitute emergency circumstances making it necessary that the Tax
Exemption for Teacher Awards Emergency Act of 2013 be adopted after a single reading.
Sec. 4. This resolution shall take effect immediately.
